images.summary: This image shows the west elevation of the residence, detailing the exterior view with proposed changes. The elevation includes multiple levels, with the top of the existing roof at 6.17 meters and the basement at -1.47 meters. Proposed wood railings are to comply with SB10, as referenced in TACBOC details 3/S02. The structure includes a 4"x4" post fastened to a 10" concrete pier, with specifications for a Simpson post base. The elevation also shows window and door placements, and the overall building height is clearly depicted.

The elevation includes multiple levels, with the top of the existing roof at 6.17 meters and the basement at -1.47 meters. Proposed wood railings are to comply with SB10, as referenced in TACBOC details 3/S02. images.summary: This detail shows a sonotube foundation system for the basement level. The detail includes a timber column supported by a concrete pier, with a concrete column footing. The Simpson post base is specified as per plan. The foundation is designed to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill, as approved by a geotechnical engineer. The grade level is marked at 4'-0". This detail provides specifications for the size and reinforcing of the concrete pier and column footing, which are to be referenced from the plan.

images.summary: This plan outlines the proposed structural layout for the basement, including areas designated as unexcavated and a crawl space. The mechanical/laundry room is also shown. The plan includes various dimensions, such as 21'-4" and 39'-4", indicating the layout's size. The hatched area is marked to remain unchanged. Construction notes emphasize reporting discrepancies to the designer before proceeding. Section callouts 2/A04 and 3/A04 are included for further reference. The plan provides a comprehensive view of the basement's structural elements and layout.

images.summary: This plan view shows the proposed rear wood deck layout for the basement level. The deck is supported by 4"x4" posts fastened to 10" concrete piers with Simpson post bases, specifically ABA44Z anchored with 1/2" diameter bolts. The outline of precast concrete anchor stringers is shown, secured with 2-3/8" diameter thru bolts and washers. The deck structure includes 2"x12" PT stringers and 2"x8" PT deck joists spaced at 16 inches on center. A 2"x8" PT ledger is fastened to the existing concrete wall with 1/2" diameter wedge anchors, staggered at 16 inches on center with a minimum embedment of 4 inches. The plan specifies the use of (2) 1.75" x 11.875" LVL beams. Dimensions provided include a deck length of 13'-1" and a width of 15'-11". The plan emphasizes the need for fastening beams to posts with EPC42 connectors.

POSTS - UC4.1D

images.summary: This image contains general notes related to the proposed basement structural plan. The notes specify the pressure-treated (P.T.) ratings for various components: decking is rated UC3.2B, ledger boards, joists, beams, and stair stringers are rated UC3.2C, and posts are rated UC4.1D. All exterior LVL beams must be wrapped against moisture. The number of risers is to be confirmed on-site before work begins, and the existing grade is to remain unchanged. A note emphasizes that the contractor must verify all assumed joist directions and the location of all beams and columns on-site, reporting any discrepancies to the designer before proceeding.

images.summary: This plan illustrates the structural layout for the first floor, including the family room, kitchen, living room, and garage. Existing floor joists and beams are to remain, as well as existing roof trusses. The proposed wood deck is detailed, with wood railings required to comply with SB-10 standards, referencing detail 3/S2. The plan includes section callouts 2/A04, 3/A04, and 1/A04, indicating connections to other sheets. Element callouts include W1, W2, and DJ, identifying specific wall and joist types. Dimensions are provided for various sections, such as a total width of 39'-4" and specific room dimensions. The plan specifies the attachment of a 2"x9 1/2" LVL to the girder truss bottom, with details for built-up studs at each end.

images.summary: This image contains general notes for the first floor structural plan. The notes specify pressure-treated (P.T.) ratings: decking is UC3.2B, ledger boards, joists, beams, and stair stringers are UC3.2C, and posts are UC4.1D. All exterior LVL beams must be wrapped against moisture. The number of risers must be confirmed on-site before work begins, and the existing grade is to remain unchanged. A note emphasizes that the contractor must verify all assumed joist directions and the location of all beams and columns on-site, reporting any discrepancies to the designer before proceeding.

images.text_verbatim:
DECK DETAIL
1" = 1'-0"
CONTINUOUS 38x140 TOP RAIL
38x38 PICKETS SECURED W/ 2 - 76mm SCREWS OR OTHER APPROVED GUARD SYSTEM
LESS THAN 100mm OPENING BETWEEN PICKETS & NO MEMBER OR ATTACHMENT BETWEEN 140mm & 900mm SHALL FACILITATE CLIMBING
NEW POURED CONCRETE DOOR SILL W/ 0.5mm POLY FLASHING UP BEHIND
4 - #4 x 76mm SCREWS BOTH SIDES OR 2 - 9.5mm THRU BOLTS C/W 32mm O.D. WASHERS
WOOD DECKING W/ 6mm GAPS PERPENDICULAR TO DECK JOIST FRAMING
JOIST HANGERS
WOOD BEAM W/ PLYWOOD FILLER & 38x84 GUSSETS ON BOTH SIDES OF POST 16mm SCREWS OR 16x115 METAL POST BEAM CONNECTOR
JOIST SPAN
WOOD POST ANCHORED TO CONC. PIER AS PER STRUCTURAL DRAWINGS
POURED CONCRETE PIER MIN. 1200mm BELOW GRADE ON UNDISTURBED SOIL, FOR SIZES SEE SHEET D01
MAX. 400mm FOR 38x184 JOIST
MAX. 600mm FOR 38x235 JOIST
MAX. 1/6 OF JOIST SPAN
EXISTING FLOOR STRUCTURE
EXISTING RIM JOIST & SILL PLATE
DOUBLE 38x184 LEDGER LAG BOLTED TO FDN. WALL W/ 12.7mm DIA. BOLTS @ 800mm O.C. MIN. INTO SOLID MASONRY OR CONCRETE
images.summary: This detail illustrates the connection of a wood deck to the existing structure. The deck features a continuous 38x140 top rail with 38x38 pickets secured by 76mm screws or an approved guard system. Openings between pickets are less than 100mm to prevent climbing. The deck includes wood decking with 6mm gaps perpendicular to the joist framing. Joist hangers support the structure, and a wood beam with plywood filler and gussets is connected using 16mm screws or metal post beam connectors. The wood post is anchored to a concrete pier, which is poured a minimum of 1200mm below grade on undisturbed soil. The detail specifies maximum joist spans and connections to the existing floor structure, including a double ledger lag bolted to the foundation wall with 12.7mm diameter bolts spaced at 800mm on center.

images.summary: This detail shows a deck structure with specific emphasis on the stringer and guard assembly. The deck detail, labeled as 'DECK DETAIL 2', is drawn at a scale of 1" = 1'-0". It specifies the use of 89x89 support posts spaced at 1200mm on center. Stringers are anchored to precast concrete using 9.5mm diameter thru bolts with 32mm O.D. washers. The minimum stringer depth is 285mm. The detail includes a continuous 50x100 guard and requires a 900mm high handrail if there are more than three risers. Openings between pickets must be less than 100mm, and no member or attachment should facilitate climbing between 140mm and 900mm. The use of #7x63 screws at each picket and corrosion-resistant spiral nails or screws is specified. Wood blocking is required at 1200mm on center minimum between stringers.

images.text_verbatim:
4
BEAM DETAIL
1" = 1'-0"
EXISTING GIRDER TRUSS TO REMAIN
NAIL (2) 9 1/2" LVL TO EXISTING GIRDER TRUSS
(3) 3 1/4" COMMON NAILS @ 8" O.C.
images.summary: This beam detail illustrates the connection between a new LVL and an existing girder truss. The detail, labeled 'BEAM DETAIL', is drawn at a scale of 1" = 1'-0". It specifies that the existing girder truss is to remain in place. Two 9 1/2" LVLs are to be nailed to the existing girder truss using three 3 1/4" common nails spaced at 8 inches on center. This detail focuses on the reinforcement and connection method for integrating new structural elements with existing components.

images.summary: This detail shows a deck structure with specific emphasis on the stringer and guard assembly. The deck detail, labeled as 'DECK DETAIL 2', is drawn at a scale of 1" = 1'-0". It specifies the use of 89x89 support posts spaced at 1200mm on center. Stringers are anchored to precast concrete using 9.5mm diameter thru bolts with 32mm O.D. washers. The minimum stringer depth is 285mm. The detail includes a continuous 50x100 guard and requires a 900mm high handrail if there are more than three risers. Openings between pickets must be less than 100mm, and no member or attachment should facilitate climbing between 140mm and 900mm. The use of #7x63 screws at each picket and corrosion-resistant spiral nails or screws is specified. Wood blocking is required at 1200mm on center minimum between stringers.
